p: Meanwhile, the (+)-catechin is a flavonoid present in leaves of green tea, wine, and fruits [ 84, 85]. Grzesik et al. investigated the antioxidant action of catechin through the ABTS scavenging activity and FRAP tests. The results show values of 3.965 ± 0.067 (mol Trolox equivalents/mol) and 0.793 ± 0.004 (mol Trolox equivalents/mol), respectively. In addition, catechin shows greater protective properties in the dihydrorhodamine 123 oxidation assay (IC 500.805 ± 0.072 μM) than GSH and ascorbic acid (14.1 and 13.9 μM, respectively) [ 86].
